thread.title: Middlesbrough transfer news: Rudy Gestede arrives on Teesside to complete medical ahead of £6million switch
thread.title_full: Middlesbrough transfer news: Rudy Gestede arrives on Teesside to complete medical ahead of £6million switch

author: rforrester
title: Middlesbrough transfer news: Rudy Gestede arrives on Teesside to complete medical ahead of £6million switch
text:
Comments RUDY GESTEDE is on Teesside to undergo his medical ahead of a £6million switch to Middlesbrough. 3 Rudy Gestede is closing in on his Premier League return 
And it looks as though the Premier League strugglers will waste no time in bolstering their strike force by landing the 28-year-old as they brace themselves for a relegation dogfight. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog. 
Gestede scored five goals in 29 appearances for Aston Villa last season before they were relegated and has found the net four times this campaign. 
The 17 goals scored by Karanka’s side this season remains joint second lowest alongside Sunderland. Only Hull have a worst goalscoring record having scored 16 goals in 19 games. 
Gestede is expected to watch Middlesbrough’s clash with Leicester from the stands and could make his debut in Boro’s FA Cup third round clash against Sheffield Wednesday next weekend according to the Daily Mail . PA:Press Association Rudy Gestede has scored four goals for Villa this season but has spent most of his time on the bench related articles Relegation scrap Premier League Live - Middlesbrough take on Leicester side still missing Jamie Vardy who sits out final game of three-match ban BOOKIES BEWARE With nearly a full New Year's fixture list for punters to have a flutter on, we reveal Britain's top ten hotspots for football accumulator wins Rudy's Prem return Aston Villa striker Rudy Gestede set for £6m move to Middlesbrough bidding war What are the biggest football transfers of all time, and what are the British records? Goals of the Week : Watch the finest strikes from the Premier League Week Reuters 3 Jordan Rhodes is set to leave Boro in the January transfer window 
His arrival is set to spell the end for Jordan Rhodes who has mustered a measly 208 minutes of league action this season without a goal. 
David Nugent could also find himself on the move in January having made just four substitute appearances.
